form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Tillis introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To provide for a waiver of duplication of benefits for certain assistance under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act as a result of a major disaster or emergency, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Helene Small Business Recovery Act.

subsection.text: In this section, the terms major disaster and emergency have the meanings given the terms in section 102 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5122).

paragraph.text: The President may waive section 312(a) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5155(a)) upon the request of a Governor on behalf of the State or on behalf of a person, business concern, or any other entity suffering losses as a result of a major disaster or emergency if the President finds that the waiverâ€”

subparagraph.text: is in the public interest; and
will not result in waste, fraud, or abuse.

paragraph.text: In determining whether to grant a waiver under paragraph (1), the President may consider the following:

subparagraph.text: The recommendations of the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency made in consultation with the Federal agency or agencies administering the relevant duplicative program.
If a wavier is granted, whether the assistance to be funded is cost effective.
Other matters of public policy considered appropriate by the President.

paragraph.text: Not later than 45 days after the date of submission of a request under paragraph (1), the President shall grant or deny the request.

paragraph.header: Prohibition on determination that loan is a duplication
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding section 312(c) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5155(c)), in carrying out paragraph (1), the President may not determine that a loan is a duplication of assistance if all Federal assistance is used toward a loss suffered as a result of a major disaster or emergency.
In carrying out this subsection, no income threshold may be applied to limit the eligibility of a recipient from qualifying for a waiver.

subsection.text: Subsection (b) shall apply to the provision of assistance in response to a major disaster or emergency declared by the President under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5121 et seq.) that occurred during calendar year 2023 or 2024.
